prompt: Write a poem about underpass echo in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Use a few invented coinages and a named creature. Avoid copying lines from the original.
poem:
The Grumblepass Echo

Through snickered walls of concrete grey,
The bricklethorns grow wild and sway,
While Munglewumps do softly creep
Where shadow-sounds refuse to sleep.

The echo-thump of passing feet
Makes whiffling music, bitter-sweet,
And every screech of tire or brake
Sets slithered echoes half-awake.

The sound-waves bounce and multiplump,
Like rubber balls that bounce and jump,
Till Munglewump, with furgled ears,
Conducts the noise of passing years.

O listen to the splendid din!
The ways sound out, the ways sound in,
As concrete catches every note
And tosses back what cars denote.
label: medium

prompt: Write a poem about morning fog in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep a playful ballad cadence with some rhyme. Add an admonition or preparation and a celebratory return. Use some invented words.
poem:
The Mornling Mists

'Twas brimpling, and the slifty fog
Did swive and wimble round the trees;
All misty were the pollywogs,
And dawn-mists made one sneeze.

"Beware the thickening smother-clouds,
The tendrils that embrace and creep!
Avoid the murkling smoky shrouds
Where vishlings float and sleep!"

Armed with my glimmermatic light,
I sought the path through pearly grey—
Through whispering wisps of morning white,
Where shadow-shapes held sway.

And then! The galliant sun burst through,
The foglings fled in disarray!
The world turned bright, the skies turned blue,
And crystal-clear the day!

'Twas brillig now, the fog dissolved,
Like dreams that fade at morning's call;
The mysteries at last resolved—
No mists remained at all!
label: medium

prompt: Write a poem about déjà vu in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Use a few invented coinages and a named creature. Avoid copying lines from the original.
poem:
The Déjà Whiffler

'Twas slithy in my misting mind,
When memories, twice-entwined,
Did gyre and wimble, round and round,
Like footprints in rewinding ground.

The Déjà Whiffler spins its dance,
Through moments caught in double-glance,
Where past and present intermesh
In time's repeating, folding fresh.

"Beware!" I thought, "This scene I know!"
Yet knowing slips like melting snow,
While echoes of what's yet to be
Splice now with what I've lived to see.

The chronal loops grew brillig-bright,
As recognition took its flight,
Until at last the moment passed—
First time or second? First or last?
label: low

prompt: Write a poem about desire path in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep a playful ballad cadence with some rhyme. Add an admonition or preparation and a celebratory return. Use some invented words.
poem:
The Treadsome Way

Beware the pathling through the green,
Where snazzled grass and muckwort lean!
The footsteps of the hurryfolk
Have smooshed the lawn from dusk till een.

"O heed the signs! Keep off!" they cry,
But scurrysome folk still pass thereby,
The concrete path, so propermore,
Left lonely 'neath the whiffling sky.

And as the trampled track grows wide,
Where splunkish mud and bootprints ride,
The desirepath claims victory—
Now paved and proper, sanctified!

O frabjous day! The people's way
Has won its place in light of day,
Where once the grasslings stood so tall,
Now all may walk the shortcut's sway!

prompt: Write a poem about conference room in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Use a few invented coinages and a named creature. Avoid copying lines from the original.
poem:
The Snufflemeeting

'Twas bizzling in the meeting space,
Where whiteboards gleamed with markered trace.
The Chairborn sat all smuggified,
While workers slumped, quite frazzled-faced.

"Beware the Consultorg, my friend!
His PowerPoints that never end,
His market-speak, his corporate prose,
His KPIs that downward bend!"

They took their laptops in their hands,
Long time the agenda-foe they planned—
Then rested by the coffee pot,
And stood awhile in thought unmanned.

And as in dullish thought they stayed,
The Consultorg, with charts displayed,
Came waffling through the sliding door,
And buzzwords as he brayed!

One-two! One-two! Through charts and graphs,
The meeting minutes slipped in half!
They dozed him dead, and with their pride
They snuck back through the staff.

"And hast thou slain the Consultorg?
Come to my desk, my bleary org!
O frabjous day! No meetings more!"
They chortled in their joy.

'Twas bizzling in the meeting space,
Where whiteboards gleamed with markered trace.
The Chairborn sat all smuggified,
While workers slumped, quite frazzled-faced.

poem:
The Whisperscream of Song

"Beware the tunebeast's wailing call,
The fluttertones that rise and fall,
The drumblast's boom, the stringling's flight—
Keep close your ears this music night!"

Through gleaming pipes and brassling maze,
Where whispernotes in shimmer-haze
Dance wild upon the soundful air,
The chordlings twist with merry flare.

The melotooth grew sharp and bright,
While harmony storms raged in sight,
Till every singling soul took wing
And made the soundwalls dance and ring.

"O frabjous song! O sweet refrain!
The tunebeast's tamed, we're safe again!"
Through crescendrift and rhythmswirl sweet,
The music room made joy complete.

poem:
The Cartomancer's Tale

'Twas whimble, and the slythy paths
Did wind and wamble on the page,
The compast points showed wrathful wraths,
While meridians did rage.

"Beware the Griddersnatch, my son!
The lines that twist, the scales that bite!
Beware the legend box, and shun
The bearings that mislead at night!"

He took his trusty pencil sharp,
Long time the paper foe he sought—
Then rested by the contour harp,
And stood awhile in thought.

And as in mapfish thought he stood,
The Griddersnatch, with eyes of flame,
Came snurfling through the paper wood,
And squiggled as it came!

One, two! One, two! And through and through
The graphite blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head
He found his journey back.

"And hast thou slain the Griddersnatch?
Come to my arms, my cartograph boy!
O frabjous maps! O compass catch!"
He chortled in his joy.

'Twas whimble, and the slythy paths
Did wind and wamble on the page,
The compast points showed wrathful wraths,
While meridians did rage.

poem:
The Lurking of Layover Bay

'Twas gloaming in the terminal hold,
The weary travelers, mired and cold,
Did grump and grumble in their seats
While slithy screens showed more delays.

"Beware the Layover Bay, my friend!
The endless hours that never end,
The blithering gates, the cranky crew,
The overpriced snackfood too!"

He took his rolling bag in hand,
Through security's maze did bravely stand,
And rested by the whiffling shop
Where lurbled voices never stop.

And as in caffeine thoughts he slumped,
The connection flight, with engines pumped,
Came ready through departure's door,
And burbled as it had before!

One, two! One, two! His pass in sight,
The boarding line moved left and right!
He found his seat, callooh! callay!
He'd conquered dread old Layover Bay!

'Twas freedom from the terminal hold,
The weary traveler, blessed and bold,
Did soar away through cloudy heights,
Far from those lurbling layover nights.

The Ghostmark's Tale

'Twas brillig on my OLED,
When phosphors bright did glow and fade,
The static icons, whiffling red,
Left spectres where they stayed.

"Beware the Ghostmark, son!" they said,
"The haunts that burn, the shades that stain!
Beware the Pixelsnatch, and dread
The marks that long remain!"

He took his anti-burn in hand,
Long time the phantom foe he sought—
Then rested he by the screensave tree,
And stood awhile in thought.

And as in darkish thought he stood,
The Ghostmark, with its umbrous gleam,
Came seeping through the displaywood,
And scorched him in its beam!

One, two! One, two! His screenwash true
The cleaning program flew about!
He fixed the burn, and with a turn,
He cleared the phantom out!

"And hast thou slain the Ghostmark bright?
Come to my arms, my techish boy!
O frabjous display! Hip hooray!"
He chortled in his joy.

'Twas brillig on my OLED,
The phosphors fresh did glow and fade,
No static icons, crisp instead,
And no more spectres stayed.

poem:
The Snazzlebeast

Through gloaming mist and glumpish trees,
Where spindrils twitch in evening breeze,
The Snazzlebeast with crimpled claws
And sharpsome teeth in drooling jaws.

It slimpers forth on padded feet,
Its shadow stretches down the street,
While children sleep in cozy beds,
It scritches 'round their window-heads.

With yellowed eyes that gleam and peek,
And furgled fur both slick and sleek,
It prowls and purrs its luresome song—
Don't venture where you don't belong.

For when the moon hangs pale and high,
And nightwraiths dance across the sky,
The Snazzlebeast will surely creep
To steal your dreams while you're asleep.

The Sciencefair Slair

Where brimbling projects sputter and flare!
The bubbleflasks all whiffle bright,
And snarkling circuits spark with fright.

"Your hypothesis might wimbly fall!

Took up the tools with brillig zest,
To put each theory to the test.

And as experiments came clear,
The boards stood proud, results sincere!
"O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!"
First prize ribbon won that day!

Now back through hallways, victory sweet,
Past fizzing potions, triumph complete,
Where once was doubt, now glory stands,
Blue ribbon clutched in trembling hands.

The Needlenose, now tucked in bed,

The conference room, my dearest friend.

The Snarglet's Return

'Twas whirrish, and the memorgyle
Did twist and tumble in my mind:
All floatsome were the thoughts so vile
Of things I'd left behind.

Came slinking through my mental haze—
With splittered claws and mirrored stare
Through time's repeated maze.

"But wait!" I thought, "I've seen before
This very moment, crisp and clear!"
The Snarglet grinned from floor to floor,
Both there and also here.

In spiralwise confusion deep,
Till time did on itself depend
Like memories in sleep.

Still twists and tumbles in my mind:
All floatsome are these moments while
They loop and rewind.
